reference_a:
@article{flueckiger2014,
  title = {How health behaviors relate to academic performance via affect: {{An}} intensive longitudinal study},
  shorttitle = {How health behaviors relate to academic performance via affect},
  author = {Flueckiger, Lavinia and Lieb, Roselind and Meyer, Andrea H. and Mata, Jutta},
  date = {2014-10-29},
  journaltitle = {PLOS ONE},
  shortjournal = {PLOS ONE},
  volume = {9},
  number = {10},
  pages = {e111080},
  publisher = {Public Library of Science},
  doi = {10.1371/journal.pone.0111080}
}
topics: health behavior, depression, academic performance, affect

features.name: physical_activity
features.coding: Number of minutes engaged in mild, moderate and strenuous exercise weighted by metabolic equivalents and then summed to produce a total daily leisure activity score

features.name: pa
features.coding:
Mean of happy, content, cheerful
1 = not at all
7 = extremely

features.name: na
features.coding:
Mean of sad, downhearted, frustrated
1 = not at all
7 = extremely

features.name: learning_goal_achievement
features.coding:
Did you achieve the learning goals you set for yourself in the last 24 hours? (paraphrasd after item description in the paper)
0 = not at all
4 = completely
